metadata.description: Add project and global configuration support for --json and --compact flags, making them configurable via .claude/sdd_config.json files
objectives: Create reusable configuration loader following git_config.py pattern
Support project-local and global configuration files
Default to json: true, compact: true for automation-friendly output
Maintain CLI argument precedence (args override config)
Integrate seamlessly with existing CLI infrastructure

metadata.purpose: Create the configuration loading infrastructure and template files

metadata.details: Create configuration loader module mirroring git_config.py pattern with project/global precedence, validation, and default values (json: true, compact: true)
Set defaults: {"output": {"json": true, "compact": true}}
Load from .claude/sdd_config.json (project) or ~/.claude/sdd_config.json (global) with validation and fallback to defaults
Validate config structure, log warnings for invalid values, graceful fallback
Create JSON template with comments explaining each setting, precedence rules, and example values
Comprehensive documentation covering usage, configuration options, precedence, examples, and troubleshooting
Export load_sdd_config and DEFAULT_SDD_CONFIG from sdd_config module

journal.title: Decision: File Reorganization (.claude/ vs docs/)
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
During implementation, identified that .claude/ directory should only contain project-specific config files generated during setup (e.g., sdd_config.json, git_config.json), not the toolkit's template and documentation files. The template files (*.json.template) and README documentation are part of the toolkit itself, not user configurations, so they belong in docs/ with other toolkit documentation.

Impact: 
- Updated spec file paths for task-1-2 (sdd_config.json.template) and task-1-3 (SDD_CONFIG_README.md)
- Also moved existing git_config files for consistency
- Updated verification commands to reference new paths
- Updated documentation cross-references
- No impact on functionality - files are still accessible and referenced correctly

This follows proper separation of concerns: toolkit files in docs/, user configs in .claude/.

Successfully added interactive configuration prompts to cli/skills_dev/setup_permissions.py. The implementation includes:

1. New _prompt_for_config() function that asks users for:
   - JSON output preference (yes/no)
   - Compact formatting preference (if JSON enabled)

2. New _create_config_file() function that:
   - Creates .claude/sdd_config.json with user preferences
   - Shows confirmation message with chosen settings
   - Handles errors gracefully

3. Integration with cmd_update():
   - Checks if config already exists
   - Only prompts in interactive mode (skips when --json flag used)
   - Creates config before setting up permissions
   - Preserves all existing setup functionality

Verification performed:
- Tested config file creation successfully creates valid JSON structure
- Tested JSON mode (--json flag) correctly skips prompts
- Verified existing settings.json permissions setup still works
- Confirmed config file structure matches template exactly

All requirements met. The interactive setup flow now creates .claude/sdd_config.json with user's output preferences during project setup.
